Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior reserved; black-figure decoration consisting of nude youth (with added red on hair and chest) dancing, to right, with left arm lowered and left leg raised high; exterior glazed black.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the figure on the inside of the lip, see lip-cup from Naukratis, British Museum 1888,0601.609 in Williams, D., Greek Vases. London 1999, 70, fig. 52a. See also Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 146-7 (cups dated between 550-530 BC). The unusual illustration on the interior of the cup possibly shows an interaction with East Greek cups (part of Nikosthenic experimentation).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.30)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 440, no. B719)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0557) (Phase 1)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 10)
